nodes.name: Unsatisfied long-tail task demand in virtual assistants
nodes.description: Most users want assistants to perform many niche tasks that current virtual assistants do not support, leading to limited adoption and utility.
nodes.node_rationale: Highlighted in 1 Introduction: only a tiny fraction of potential tasks is available.

nodes.name: Developer resource limitations for task customization in virtual assistants
nodes.description: There will never be enough professional developers to encode every task variant individual users desire.
nodes.node_rationale: Discussed in 1 Introduction as the primary cause of unmet demand.

nodes.name: Domain dependence and NL understanding limitations in PBD systems
nodes.description: Existing programming-by-demonstration systems with variables need handcrafted ontologies and struggle with unrestricted language, impeding scalability.
nodes.node_rationale: Explained in 1 Introduction and 2 IA Problem referencing PLOW and others.

nodes.name: Non-branching program expressiveness matches popular VA tasks
aliases: non-branching programs cover majority of VA use-cases
nodes.description: Most current VA capabilities can be represented as programs with variables but without loops or conditionals, a class between macros and Turing-complete programs.
nodes.node_rationale: Argued in 1 Introduction Table 1 as the sweet-spot trade-off.

nodes.name: One-shot learning feasible with strong model biases in teachable agents
nodes.description: By constraining the hypothesis space (command templates, variable bindings) Helpa can learn a task from one user demonstration despite lack of large datasets.
nodes.node_rationale: Detailed in 3.1 Model where the authors motivate a heavily biased model.

nodes.name: End-user teachable non-branching programs without domain knowledge
nodes.description: Design principle to let non-technical users describe a command and demonstrate its execution once, enabling VA personalisation across arbitrary domains.
nodes.node_rationale: Introduced in 3 Helpa as the main design goal.

nodes.name: UI script abstraction enabling device-independent VA customization
nodes.description: All user interactions are recorded and replayed as UI scripts, decoupling Helpa from the specifics of any particular user interface or device.
nodes.node_rationale: Explained in 3.2 System Architecture—recorder/player kept outside Helpa core.

nodes.name: Helpa command-template learner with variable matching algorithm
nodes.description: Implementation that matches parameter values in a UI script to substrings in a command, constructs a command template and variable binding function from a single example.
nodes.node_rationale: Algorithm 1 in 3.2 details the step-by-step learning process.

nodes.name: UI-independent task execution via UI script recorder and player
nodes.description: Separate components capture user actions and replay UI scripts, allowing Helpa to operate on any UI given an appropriate wrapper.

nodes.name: Usability study showing 85% task success with <1 minute training
nodes.description: Across 10 websites and 10 participants, Helpa executed new commands correctly in a median 85 % of trials; users could teach tasks in a median 47 s after acclimation.

nodes.name: Observed paraphrase and adjacent variable limitations in Helpa
nodes.description: Validation revealed that Helpa fails when commands use unseen paraphrases or contain adjacent variables, limiting generality.
nodes.node_rationale: Discussed in 3.3 Limitations and failure analysis in 4.2 Results.

nodes.name: Deploy Helpa-based instructible agent in commercial virtual assistants to enable user task teaching
nodes.description: Integrate the Helpa architecture and learner into existing VA products, allowing end-users to add new non-branching tasks through demonstration.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Deployment phase—as proposed in 5 Conclusions discussing real-world adoption.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Prototype validated via usability study (4.2 Results); needs product-level engineering for operational use.
nodes.node_rationale: Direct actionable step to close the task-coverage gap identified.

nodes.name: Incorporate statistical paraphrase generation into Helpa to expand command template coverage
nodes.description: Augment Helpa with automated paraphrase generation for newly created command templates, increasing robustness to linguistic variation.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Model-design improvement suggested but not yet engineered (3.3 Limitations).
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Conceptual suggestion referencing paraphrase literature—no implementation yet.
nodes.node_rationale: Addresses the paraphrasing limitation evidenced in validation.

nodes.name: Integrate NLP partitioning for adjacent variables into Helpa variable extraction
nodes.description: Implement NLP techniques (e.g., sequence labelling) to correctly separate adjacent variables in commands, removing a current constraint.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Model-design stage upgrade based on acknowledged limitation (3.3 Limitations).
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Only proposed conceptually; no experimental validation yet.
nodes.node_rationale: Targets the adjacent-variable failure mode documented in validation.
